dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 2527 : To amend title 38, United States Code, to provide veterans with counseling and treatment for sexual trauma that occurred during inactive duty training.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Received; read twice and referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to provide veterans with counseling and treatment for sexual trauma that occurred during inactive duty training.

section.header: Counseling and treatment for sexual trauma occurring during inactive duty for training
section.text: Section 1720D of title 38, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a)(1), by striking active duty or active duty for training and inserting active duty, active duty for training, or inactive duty training; and

subparagraph.text: by striking this section, the and inserting the following:
by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.text: The term veteran, with respect to inactive duty training described in subsection (a)(1), also includes an individual who—

subparagraph.text: is not otherwise eligible for the benefits of this chapter; and
while serving in the reserve components of the Armed Forces, performed such inactive duty training but did not serve on active duty.

attestation-group.attestation-date: Passed the House of Representatives May 28, 2014.
